overview: The purpose of this Act is to emphasize the importance of compliance with the requirements enacted by Acts 62 and 199 by specifying that the budget summary must contain all required information without referring the reader to other portions of the budget. [3] The measure states that the defense of good faith compliance is unavailable to any association whose board adopts a budget that omits the required budget summary. [3] It also clarifies the ability to enforce compliance with budget summary and replacement reserves requirements and provides that an association has the burden of proving compliance. [3]
policy_impact: This measure amends Section 514B-148, Hawaii Revised Statutes, by specifying that budget summaries must contain all required information without referring the reader to other portions of the budget. [4] Your Committee has amended this measure by changing the effective date to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion. [4] The bill also makes technical, nonsubstantive amendments for the purposes of clarity, consistency, and style. [4]
six_year_fiscal_implications: This Act shall take effect on July 1, 3000. [3] Due to the amended effective date, this measure will have no fiscal implications for the State of Hawaii over the next six years. [4] The change in effective date is intended to encourage further discussion on the matter. [4] As such, no state funds are appropriated or required for implementation within the six-year fiscal planning period. [3]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: There are no fiscal implications for the State after the six-year period as this Act shall take effect on July 1, 3000. [3] No ongoing fiscal obligations for the State are anticipated until the bill's provisions become effective. [3]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The updated bill, H.B. No. 70, H.D. 1, introduces a new requirement specifying that budget summaries must contain all required information without referring the reader to other portions of the budget. [4] Most significantly, the committee has amended the measure by changing the effective date to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion. [4] This new effective date ensures the measure has no fiscal impact in the near future, which is a substantial change from the previous version of the bill. [3]
